extendedInfo.description: Are you tired of seeing a static network icon on the status bar ?Check your phone reception level, mobile data activities and network type at once with a single icon.The reception level is calculated in percentage numbers and dBm as well.(Wifi, Bluetooth signal are not supported)(This application does not support dual SIM phones because they are not supported by standard APIs)###################################################################Some of ANDROID phones are not able to use this application because they are not providing proper reception dataYou should give it a try and check first###################################################################Supporting Functions1. Phone reception information (as %) icon on the status bar2. Packet data activity information on the same icon above3. Statistics screen of the reception, network connections and data activities4. Function that gives a vibrating notification upon reception change5. Critical reception event recording function6. Cell tower location and connection history recording function (Only available on GSM phones)7. Realtime cell tower tracing and recording function8. Packet data usage limitation functionSupporting network markersLTE, HSP(A, AP, UP, DP), 3G, EDGE, GPRS, EVDO(0,A,B), 1x

reviews.title: Good fun for the wrong reasons!
reviews.comment: I find the signal meter very useful as I live in an area with variable coverage. The fun starts though when I look at the daily log. Today I have apparently visited India 3 times, Indonesia, Sweden, The Netherlands, Germany and Columbia!
reviews.author: John Kearsey

reviews.title: Good Application ..
reviews.comment: Team,  Thanks for the last update. I request if you can help to provide an option for setting the priority for the notification...like maximum, high, normal, medium& low.. that will be helpful...
reviews.author: Abhishek Chaudhary

reviews.title: Samsung Note II
reviews.comment: I Like Good n Nice App
reviews.author: Papago Papago

reviews.title: Almost perfect, but just needs a little touch-up
reviews.comment: I am using since a couple of weeks and it does what is said. Still, I look out for two changes which may improve the user experience.  1) The output of the Apps (like Cell tower trace and the browses) and the options (Others) are mixed up and may be separated using tabbed interface for ease in picking up the \'outputs\' from among the crowded \'options\'. These options when once set, may not be looked into again by a normal user.  2) The real time tower trace starts with the preset location in Europe every time the apps starts and finally reaches the current location. This takes a long time and tests the patience. Instead, the apps may remember the last used geo-location and zoom level and restore it as the starting point. I use from India, and it takes a good long 2 minutes to get the current location and required zoom.  Thanks for a good working utility :-)
reviews.author: MSR Murthy
